H0.text: Electricity is what makes the light turn on when Bobby pushes the switch on the wall to illuminate the dark room.

H1.text: Friction is what makes the light turn on when Bobby pushes the switch on the wall as he enters a dark room.

H2.text: Gravity is what makes the light turn on when Bobby pushes the switch in the dark room.

H3.text: Magnetism is what makes the light turn on when Bobby pushes the switch on the wall in a dark room.

A4.text: The invention of a practical incandescent light bulb in the 1870s led to lighting becoming one of the first publicly available applications of electrical power.

A5.text: Electric power is the rate at which electric energy is transferred by an electric circuit.
